00028 namespace RandomLib {
00029   /**
00030    * \brief Uniform random number generator.
00031    *
00032    * This implements a generic random number generator.  Such a generator
00033    * requires two data holders RandomSeed, to hold the seed, and RandomEngine,
00034    * to hold the state.  In addition we need two piece of machinery, a "Mixer"
00035    * to convert the seed into an initial state and an "Algorithm" to advance the
00036    * state.
00037    *
00038    * @tparam Algorithm the random number algorithm.
00039    * @tparam Mixer the way seeds are turned into state.
00040    *
00041    * RandomSeed is responsible for setting and reporting the seed.
00042    *
00043    * Mixer has no state and implements only static methods.  It needs to have
00044    * the following public interface
00045    *   - typedef mixer_t: a RandomType giving the output type
00046    *   - unsigned version: an identifying version number
00047    *   - static std::string Name(): an identifying name for the mixer
00048    *   - static method SeedToState: converts a seed into n words of state.
00049    *
00050    * Algorithm has no state and implements only static methods.  It needs to
00051    * have the following public interface
00052    *   - typedef engine_t: a RandomType giving the output type
00053    *   - typedef internal_type: a integer type used by Transition.  This is
00054    *     usually the same as engine_t::type.  However it allows the use of
00055    *     vector instructions on some platforms.  We require that engine_t::type
00056    *     and internal_type line up properly in a union so that there is no need
00057    *     to convert the data explicitly between internal_type and
00058    *     engine_t::type.
00059    *   - unsigned version: an identifying version number
00060    *   - static std::string Name(): an identifying name for the mixer
00061    *   - enum N: the size of the state in units of engine_t.
00062    *   - static method Transition: steps the generator forwards or backwards.
00063    *   - static method Generate: tempers the state immediately prior to output
00064    *   - static method NormalizeState: force the initial state (the result of
00065    *     the Mixer) into a legal state.
00066    *   - static method CheckState accumulates the checksum for the state into
00067    *     check.  In addition it throws an exception if the state is bad.
00068    *
00069    * RandomEngine is the glue that holds everything together.  It repacks
00070    * the mixer_t data from Mixer into engine_t if necessary.  It deals with
00071    * delivering individual random results, stepping the state forwards and
00072    * backwards, leapfrogging the generator, I/O of the generator, etc.
00073    *
00074    * Written by Charles Karney <charles@karney.com> and licensed under the
00075    * MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00076    * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00077    **********************************************************************/
00078   template<class Algorithm, class Mixer>
00079   class RANDOM_EXPORT RandomEngine : public RandomSeed {
00080   private:
00081     /**
00082      * The result RandomType (carried over from the \e Algorithm).
00083      **********************************************************************/
00084     typedef typename Algorithm::engine_t result_t;
00085     /**
00086      * The RandomType used by the \e Mixer.
00087      **********************************************************************/
00088     typedef typename Mixer::mixer_t mixer_t;
00089     /**
00090      * The internal_type used by the Algorithm::Transition().
00091      **********************************************************************/
00092     typedef typename Algorithm::internal_type engine_type;
00093   public:
00094     /**
00095      * The number of random bits produced by Ran().
00096      **********************************************************************/
00097     enum {
00098       width = result_t::width
00099     };
00100 
00101     /**
00102      * A type large enough to hold \e width bits.  This is used for the
00103      * internal state of the generator and the result returned by Ran().
00104      **********************************************************************/
00105     typedef typename result_t::type result_type;
00106 
00107     /**
00108      * The minimum result returned by Ran() = 0.
00109      **********************************************************************/
00110     static const result_type min = result_t::min;
00111 
00112     /**
00113      * The maximum result returned by Ran() = 2<sup><i>w</i></sup> - 1.
00114      **********************************************************************/
00115     static const result_type max = result_t::max;
00116 
00117   protected:
00118 
00119     /**
00120      * The mask for the result_t.
00121      **********************************************************************/
00122     static const result_type mask = result_t::mask;
00123 
00124   private:
00125     /**
00126      * A version number "RandLib0" to ensure safety of Save/Load.  The first 7
00127      * bytes can be regarded as a "signature" and the 8th byte a version
00128      * number.
00129      **********************************************************************/
00130     static const u64::type version = 0x52616e644c696230ULL; // 'RandLib0'
00131     /**
00132      * Marker for uninitialized object
00133      **********************************************************************/
00134     static const unsigned UNINIT = 0xffffffffU;
00135     enum {
00136       /**
00137        * The size of the state in units of result_type
00138        **********************************************************************/
00139       N = Algorithm::N,
00140       /**
00141        * The size of the state in units of mixer_t::type
00142        **********************************************************************/
00143       NU = (N * width + mixer_t::width - 1) / mixer_t::width,
00144       /**
00145        * The size of the state in units of engine_type.
00146        **********************************************************************/
00147       NV = N * sizeof(result_type) / sizeof(engine_type)
00148     };
00149 
00150     /**
00151      * \brief Union for the state.
00152      *
00153      * A union to hold the state in the result_type, mixer_t::type, and
00154      * engine_type representations.
00155      **********************************************************************/
00156     union {
00157       /**
00158        * the result_type representation returned by Ran()
00159        **********************************************************************/
00160       result_type _state[N];
00161       /**
00162        * the mixer_t::type representation returned by Mixer::SeedToState.
00163        **********************************************************************/
00164       typename mixer_t::type _stateu[NU];
00165       /**
00166        * the engine_type representation returned by Algorithm::Transition.
00167        **********************************************************************/
00168       engine_type _statev[NV];
00169     };
00170 
00171     /**
00172      * The index for the next random value
00173      **********************************************************************/
00174     unsigned _ptr;
00175     /**
00176      * How many times has Transition() been called
00177      **********************************************************************/
00178     long long _rounds;
00179     /**
00180      * Stride for leapfrogging
00181      **********************************************************************/
00182     unsigned _stride;
00183 
00184   public:
00185 
00186     /**
00187      * \name Constructors
00188      **********************************************************************/
00189     ///@{
00190     /**
00191      * Initialize from a vector.  Only the low \e 32 bits of each element are
00192      * used.
00193      *
00194      * @tparam IntType the integral type of the elements of the vector.
00195      * @param[in] v the vector of elements.
00196      **********************************************************************/
00197     template<typename IntType>
00198     explicit RandomEngine(const std::vector<IntType>& v) { Reseed(v); }
00199     /**
00200      * Initialize from a pair of iterators setting seed to [\e a, \e b).  The
00201      * iterator must produce results which can be converted into seed_type.
00202      * Only the low \e 32 bits of each element are used.
00203      *
00204      * @tparam InputIterator the type of the iterator.
00205      * @param[in] a the beginning iterator.
00206      * @param[in] b the ending iterator.
00207      **********************************************************************/
00208     template<typename InputIterator>
00209     RandomEngine(InputIterator a, InputIterator b) { Reseed(a, b); }
00210     /**
00211      * Initialize with seed [\e n].  Only the low \e width bits of \e n are
00212      * used.
00213      *
00214      * @param[in] n the new seed to use.
00215      **********************************************************************/
00216     explicit RandomEngine(seed_type n) { Reseed(n); }
00217     /**
00218      * Initialize with seed [].  This can be followed by a call to Reseed() to
00219      * select a unique seed.
00220      **********************************************************************/
00221     RandomEngine() { unsigned long s[1]; Reseed(s, s); }
00222     /**
00223      * Initialize from a string.  See Reseed(const std::string& s)
00224      *
00225      * @param[in] s the string to be decoded into a seed.
00226      **********************************************************************/
00227     explicit RandomEngine(const std::string& s) { Reseed(s); }
00228 
00229     ///@}
00230 
00231     /**
00232      * \name Functions for returning random data
00233      **********************************************************************/
00234     ///@{
00235     /**
00236      * Return \e width bits of randomness.  This is the natural unit of random
00237      * data produced random number generator.
00238      *
00239      * @return the next random number of width \e width.
00240      **********************************************************************/
00241     result_type Ran() throw() {
00242       if (_ptr >= N)
00243         Next();
00244       result_type y = _state[_ptr];
00245       _ptr += _stride;
00246 
00247       return Algorithm::Generate(y);
00248     }
00249 
00250     /**
00251      * Return 32 bits of randomness.
00252      *
00253      * @return a 32-bit random number.
00254      **********************************************************************/
00255     u32::type Ran32() throw() {
00256       //      return width > 32 ? u32::cast(Ran()) : Ran();
00257       return u32::cast(Ran());
00258     }
00259 
00260     /**
00261      * Return 64 bits of randomness.
00262      *
00263      * @return a 64-bit random number.
00264      **********************************************************************/
00265     u64::type Ran64() throw() {
00266       const u64::type x = Ran();
00267       return width > 32 ? x : u64::cast(Ran()) << (64 - width) | x;
00268     }
00269 
00270     /**
00271      * Return \e width bits of randomness.  Result is in [0,
00272      * 2<sup><i>w</i></sup>).  (This just calls Ran().)
00273      *
00274      * @return the next random number of width \e width.
00275      **********************************************************************/
00276     result_type operator()() throw() { return Ran(); }
00277     ///@}
00278 
00279 #if defined(HAVE_SSE2) && HAVE_SSE2 && defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(_WIN64)
00280     /**
00281      * new operator with alignment (needed for Visual Studio)
00282      **********************************************************************/
00283     void* operator new(size_t n) {
00284       void* p = _aligned_malloc(n, __alignof(RandomEngine));
00285       if (p == 0) throw std::bad_alloc("insufficient memory");
00286       return p;
00287     }
00288 
00289     /**
00290      * delete operator with alignment (needed for Visual Studio)
00291      **********************************************************************/
00292     void operator delete(void* p) { _aligned_free(p); }
00293 
00294     /**
00295      * new[] operator with alignment (needed for Visual Studio)
00296      **********************************************************************/
00297     void* operator new[](size_t n) {
00298       void* p = _aligned_malloc(n, __alignof(RandomEngine));
00299       if (p == 0) throw std::bad_alloc("insufficient memory");
00300       return p;
00301     }
00302 
00303     /**
00304      * delete[] operator with  alignment (needed for Visual Studio)
00305      **********************************************************************/
00306     void operator delete[](void* p) { _aligned_free(p); }
00307 #endif
00308 
00309     /**
00310      * \name Comparing Random objects
00311      **********************************************************************/
00312     ///@{
00313     /**
00314      * Test equality of two Random objects.  This test that the seeds match and
00315      * that they have produced the same number of random numbers.
00316      *
00317      * @param[in] r the RandomEngine object to compare.
00318      * @return true if the RandomEngine objects produce the same results.
00319      **********************************************************************/
00320     bool operator==(const RandomEngine& r) const throw()
00321     // Ensure that the two Random objects behave the same way.  Note however
00322     // that the internal states may still be different, e.g., the following all
00323     // result in Random objects which are == (with Count() == 0) but which all
00324     // have different internal states:
00325     //
00326     // Random r(0);                       _ptr == UNINIT
00327     // r.StepCount( 1); r.StepCount(-1);  _ptr == 0, _rounds ==  0
00328     // r.StepCount(-1); r.StepCount( 1);  _ptr == N, _rounds == -1
00329     { return Count() == r.Count() && _seed == r._seed &&
00330         _stride == r._stride; }
00331     /**
00332      * Test inequality of two Random objects.  See Random::operator==
00333      *
00334      * @param[in] r the RandomEngine object to compare.
00335      * @return true if the RandomEngine objects produce different results.
00336      **********************************************************************/
00337     bool operator!=(const RandomEngine& r) const throw()
00338     { return !operator==(r); }
00339     ///@}
00340 
00341     /**
00342      * \name Interchanging Random objects
00343      **********************************************************************/
00344     ///@{
00345     /**
00346      * Swap with another Random object.
00347      *
00348      * @param[in,out] t the RandomEngine object to swap with.
00349      **********************************************************************/
00350     void swap(RandomEngine& t) throw() {
00351       _seed.swap(t._seed);
00352       std::swap(_ptr, t._ptr);
00353       std::swap(_stride, t._stride);
00354       std::swap(_rounds, t._rounds);
00355       std::swap_ranges(_state, _state + N, t._state);
00356     }
00357     ///@}
00358 
00359     /**
00360      * \name Writing to and reading from a stream
00361      **********************************************************************/
00362     ///@{
00363     /**
00364      * Save the state of the Random object to an output stream.  Format is a
00365      * sequence of unsigned 32-bit integers written either in decimal (\e bin
00366      * false, text format) or in network order with most significant byte first
00367      * (\e bin true, binary format).  Data consists of:
00368      *
00369      *  - RandomLib magic string + version (2 words)
00370      *  - Algorithm version (1 word)
00371      *  - Mixer version (1 word)
00372      *  - _seed.size() (1 word)
00373      *  - _seed data (_seed.size() words)
00374      *  - _ptr (1 word)
00375      *  - _stride (1 word)
00376      *  - if _ptr != UNINIT, _rounds (2 words)
00377      *  - if _ptr != UNINIT, _state (N words or 2 N words)
00378      *  - checksum
00379      *
00380      * Shortest possible saved result consists of 8 words.  This corresponds to
00381      * RandomSeed() = [] and Count() = 0.
00382      *
00383      * @param[in,out] os the output stream.
00384      * @param[in] bin if true (the default) save in binary mode.
00385      **********************************************************************/
00386     void Save(std::ostream& os, bool bin = true) const;
00387     /**
00388      * Restore the state of the Random object from an input stream.  If \e bin,
00389      * read in binary, else use text format.  See documentation of
00390      * RandomEngine::Save for the format.  Include error checking on data to
00391      * make sure the input has not been corrupted.  If an error occurs while
00392      * reading, the Random object is unchanged.
00393      *
00394      * @param[in,out] is the input stream.
00395      * @param[in] bin if true (the default) load in binary mode.
00396      **********************************************************************/
00397     void Load(std::istream& is, bool bin = true) {
00398       // Read state into temporary so as not to change object on error.
00399       RandomEngine t(is, bin);
00400       _seed.reserve(t._seed.size());
00401       *this = t;
00402     }
00403     ///@}
00404 
00405     /**
00406      * \name Basic I/O
00407      **********************************************************************/
00408     ///@{
00409     /**
00410      * Write the state of a generator to stream \e os as text
00411      *
00412      * @param[in,out] os the output stream.
00413      * @param[in] r the RandomEngine object to be saved.
00414      **********************************************************************/
00415     friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const RandomEngine& r) {
00416       r.Save(os, false);
00417       return os;
00418     }
00419 
00420     /**
00421      * Read the state of a generator from stream \e is as text
00422      *
00423      * @param[in,out] is the output stream.
00424      * @param[in] r the RandomEngine object to be loaded.
00425      **********************************************************************/
00426     friend std::istream& operator>>(std::istream& is, RandomEngine& r) {
00427       r.Load(is, false);
00428       return is;
00429     }
00430     ///@}
00431 
00432     /**
00433      * \name Examining and advancing the Random generator
00434      **********************************************************************/
00435     ///@{
00436     /**
00437      * Return the number of random numbers used.  This needs to return a long
00438      * long result since it can reasonably exceed 2<sup>31</sup>.  (On a 1GHz
00439      * machine, it takes about a minute to produce 2<sup>32</sup> random
00440      * numbers.)  More precisely this is the (zero-based) index of the next
00441      * random number to be produced.  (This distinction is important when
00442      * leapfrogging is in effect.)
00443      *
00444      * @return the count of random numbers used.
00445      **********************************************************************/
00446     long long Count() const throw()
00447     { return _ptr == UNINIT ? 0 : _rounds * N + _ptr; }
00448     /**
00449      * Step the generator forwards or backwards so that the value returned
00450      * by Count() is \e n
00451      *
00452      * @param[in] n the new count.
00453      **********************************************************************/
00454     void SetCount(long long n) throw() { StepCount(n - Count()); }
00455     /**
00456      * Step the generator forward \e n steps.  \e n can be negative.
00457      *
00458      * @param[in] n how much to step the generator forward.
00459      **********************************************************************/
00460     void StepCount(long long n) throw();
00461     /**
00462      * Resets the sequence.  Equivalent to SetCount(0), but works by
00463      * reinitializing the Random object from its seed, rather than by stepping
00464      * the sequence backwards.  In addition, this undoes leapfrogging.
00465      **********************************************************************/
00466     void Reset() throw() { _ptr = UNINIT; _stride = 1; }
00467     ///@}
00468 
00469     /**
00470      * \name Leapfrogging
00471      **********************************************************************/
00472     ///@{
00473     /**
00474      * Set leapfrogging stride to a positive number \e n and increment Count()
00475      * by \e k < \e n.  If the current Count() is \e i, then normally the next
00476      * 3 random numbers would have (zero-based) indices \e i, \e i + 1, \e i +
00477      * 2, and the new Count() is \e i + 2.  However, after SetStride(\e n, \e
00478      * k) the next 3 random numbers have indices \e i + \e k, \e i + \e k + \e
00479      * n, \e i + \e k + 2\e n, and the new Count() is \e i + \e k + 3\e n.
00480      * With leapfrogging in effect, the time to produce raw random numbers is
00481      * roughly proportional to 1 + (\e n - 1)/3.  Reseed(...) and Reset() both
00482      * reset the stride back to 1.  See \ref parallel for a description of how
00483      * to use this facility.
00484      *
00485      * @param[in] n the stride (default 1).
00486      * @param[in] k the initial increment (default 0).
00487      **********************************************************************/
00488     void SetStride(unsigned n = 1, unsigned k = 0) {
00489       // Limit stride to UNINIT/2.  This catches negative numbers that have
00490       // been cast into unsigned.  In reality the stride should be no more than
00491       // 10-100.
00492       if (n == 0 || n > UNINIT/2)
00493         throw RandomErr("RandomEngine: Invalid stride");
00494       if (k >= n)
00495         throw RandomErr("RandomEngine: Invalid offset");
00496       _stride = n;
00497       StepCount(k);
00498     }
00499     /**
00500      * Return leapfrogging stride.
00501      *
00502      * *return the string.
00503      **********************************************************************/
00504     unsigned GetStride() const throw() { return _stride; }
00505     ///@}
00506 
00507     /**
00508      * Tests basic engine.  Throws out_of_range errors on bad results.
00509      **********************************************************************/
00510     static void SelfTest();
00511 
00512     /**
00513      * Return the name of the generator.  This incorporates the names of the \e
00514      * Algorithm and \e Mixer.
00515      *
00516      * @return the nae of the generator.
00517      **********************************************************************/
00518     static std::string Name() {
00519       return "RandomEngine<" + Algorithm::Name() + "," + Mixer::Name() + ">";
00520     }
00521 
00522   private:
00523     /**
00524      * Compute initial state from seed
00525      **********************************************************************/
00526     void Init() throw();
00527     /**
00528      * The interface to Transition used by Ran().
00529      **********************************************************************/
00530     void Next() throw() {
00531       if (_ptr == UNINIT)
00532         Init();
00533       _rounds += _ptr/N;
00534       Algorithm::Transition(_ptr/N, _statev);
00535       _ptr %= N;
00536     }
00537 
00538     u32::type Check(u64::type v, u32::type e, u32::type m) const;
00539 
00540     static result_type SelfTestResult(unsigned k) throw() {
00541       return 0;
00542     }
00543 
00544     /**
00545      * Read from an input stream.  Potentially corrupts object.  This private
00546      * constructor is used by RandomEngine::Load so that it can avoid
00547      * corrupting its state on bad input.
00548      **********************************************************************/
00549     explicit RandomEngine(std::istream& is, bool bin);
00550 
00551 #if !defined(RANDOMLIB_BUILDING_LIBRARY) && \
00552   defined(HAVE_BOOST_SERIALIZATION) && HAVE_BOOST_SERIALIZATION
00553     friend class boost::serialization::access;
00554     /**
00555      * Save to a boost archive.  Boost versioning isn't very robust.  (It
00556      * allows a RandomGenerator32 to be read back in as a RandomGenerator64.
00557      * It doesn't interact well with templates.)  So we do our own versioning
00558      * and supplement this with a checksum.
00559      **********************************************************************/
00560     template<class Archive> void save(Archive& ar, const unsigned int) const {
00561       u64::type _version = version;
00562       u32::type _eversion = Algorithm::version,
00563         _mversion = Mixer::version,
00564         _checksum = Check(_version, _eversion, _mversion);
00565       ar & boost::serialization::make_nvp("version" , _version )
00566         &  boost::serialization::make_nvp("eversion", _eversion)
00567         &  boost::serialization::make_nvp("mversion", _mversion)
00568         &  boost::serialization::make_nvp("seed"    , _seed    )
00569         &  boost::serialization::make_nvp("ptr"     , _ptr     )
00570         &  boost::serialization::make_nvp("stride"  , _stride  );
00571       if (_ptr != UNINIT)
00572         ar & boost::serialization::make_nvp("rounds", _rounds  )
00573           &  boost::serialization::make_nvp("state" , _state   );
00574       ar & boost::serialization::make_nvp("checksum", _checksum);
00575     }
00576     /**
00577      * Load from a boost archive.  Do this safely so that the current object is
00578      * not corrupted if the archive is bogus.
00579      **********************************************************************/
00580     template<class Archive> void load(Archive& ar, const unsigned int) {
00581       u64::type _version;
00582       u32::type _eversion, _mversion, _checksum;
00583       ar & boost::serialization::make_nvp("version" , _version  )
00584         &  boost::serialization::make_nvp("eversion", _eversion )
00585         &  boost::serialization::make_nvp("mversion", _mversion );
00586       RandomEngine<Algorithm, Mixer> t(std::vector<seed_type>(0));
00587       ar & boost::serialization::make_nvp("seed"    , t._seed   )
00588         &  boost::serialization::make_nvp("ptr"     , t._ptr    )
00589         &  boost::serialization::make_nvp("stride"  , t._stride );
00590       if (t._ptr != UNINIT)
00591         ar & boost::serialization::make_nvp("rounds", t._rounds )
00592           &  boost::serialization::make_nvp("state" , t._state  );
00593       ar & boost::serialization::make_nvp("checksum", _checksum );
00594       if (t.Check(_version, _eversion, _mversion) != _checksum)
00595         throw RandomErr("RandomEngine: Checksum failure");
00596       _seed.reserve(t._seed.size());
00597       *this = t;
00598     }
00599     /**
00600      * Glue the boost save and load functionality together -- a bit of boost
00601      * magic.
00602      **********************************************************************/
00603     template<class Archive>
00604     void serialize(Archive &ar, const unsigned int file_version)
00605     { boost::serialization::split_member(ar, *this, file_version); }
00606 #endif  // HAVE_BOOST_SERIALIZATION
00607 
00608   };
00609 
00610   typedef RandomEngine<MT19937  <Random_u32>, MixerSFMT> MRandomGenerator32;
00611   typedef RandomEngine<MT19937  <Random_u64>, MixerSFMT> MRandomGenerator64;
00612   typedef RandomEngine<SFMT19937<Random_u32>, MixerSFMT> SRandomGenerator32;
00613   typedef RandomEngine<SFMT19937<Random_u64>, MixerSFMT> SRandomGenerator64;
00614 
00615 } // namespace RandomLib
00616 
00617 namespace std {
00618   /**
00619    * Swap two RandomEngines.  This is about 3x faster than the default swap.
00620    *
00621    * @tparam Algorithm the algorithm for the RandomEngine.
00622    * @tparam Mixer the mixer for the RandomEngine.
00623    * @param[in,out] r the first RandomEngine to swap.
00624    * @param[in,out] s the second RandomEngine to swap.
00625    **********************************************************************/
00626   template<class Algorithm, class Mixer>
00627   void swap(RandomLib::RandomEngine<Algorithm, Mixer>& r,
00628             RandomLib::RandomEngine<Algorithm, Mixer>& s) throw() {
00629     r.swap(s);
00630   }
00631 }
00632 #endif  // RANDOMLIB_RANDOMENGINE_HPP
